job_description: Business Analyst I - job post Silicon Labs Careers 35 reviews Austin, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time We are Silicon Labs. We are a leader in secure, intelligent wireless technology for a more connected world. Our integrated hardware and software platform, intuitive development tools, unmatched ecosystem and robust support make us the ideal long-term partner in building advanced industrial, commercial, home and life applications. We make it easy for developers to solve complex wireless challenges throughout the product lifecycle and get to market quickly with innovative solutions that transform industries, grow economies and improve lives. Our IT Business Analysts are operationally focused application software specialists who assist our internal client teams by configuring, enhancing, and supporting our enterprise software systems. They are responsible for understanding our clients’ business requirements and translating those requirements into software configuration settings and specifications to enhance the software when necessary. They test the resulting software changes, and train end users on use of the resulting software. They possess strong technical skills to work with software developers, and excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work with the clients. What You’ll Do As an IT Business Analyst for our SAP ERP Sales & Distribution system, you will perform the following functions: Translate business requirements from our Sales Operations client team into software configuration settings within our SAP ERP Sales & Distribution system. Translate business requirements from our Order Fulfillment client team into software configuration settings within our SAP ERP Sales & Distribution system. Create functional design specifications for code changes to our SAP systems when required. Test resulting software configuration changes and code enhancements to ensure that business requirements are met. Create training documentation and train client end users to use the updated system. Design security roles and train clients to understand what roles they need to perform their job duties. Work with our data warehousing team to ensure reporting requirements are met. Work with other software engineering teams to ensure proper flow of data across applications. Participate in upgrades of our SAP ERP system by testing to verify that key processes continue to function normally in the upgraded system. Work with SAP customer support organization to resolve technical issues in the software. Develop B2B software for Sales and Shipping processes using standard B2B formats (Rosettanet, ANSI, EDIFACT) Who You Are A Bachelor’s degree required. Preferred degrees are BS/MS/PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Information Systems. Excellent interpersonal skills are required. Excellent written and oral communication skills are required. Work experience in software development is desired. Work experience in Agile software development methods is desired. Work experience with Enterprise Resource Planning systems is desired. Exposure to SAP is added advantage. Exposure to SAP Logistics execution, SAP CRM, SAP ABAP is desired. Exposure to the semiconductor industry is desired. are operationally focused application software specialists who assist our internal client teams by configuring, enhancing, and supporting our enterprise software systems. They are responsible for understanding our clients’ business requirements and translating those requirements into software configuration settings and specifications to enhance the software when necessary. They test the resulting software changes, and train end users on use of the resulting software. They possess strong technical skills to work with software developers, and excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work with the clients. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
